required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Using a New Human Milk Fortifier to Optimize Feeding
clinical_study.official_title: Using a New Human Milk Fortifier to Optimize Human Milk Feeding in Very Preterm Infants, a Multicenter Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to compare the safety and efficacy of a new HMF and those of other HMF used before in very preterm infants.

detailed_description.textblock: Infants with fortified human milk feeding have the same rate of growth, lower incidence of nosocomial infections and feeding intolerance compared to those with formula feeding during hospitalization. However, the currently human milk fortifiers (HMF) have some nutritional components defects to meet the needs of very preterm infants. New HMF provide higher protein and fat, which are safe and well tolerate to use in preterm infants. Study on safety and efficacy of the new HMF is insufficient in Chinese preterm infant population. Our aims are to compare the safety and efficacy of a new HMF and other HMF used before in very preterm infants. Very low preterm infants with birth weights of 1000-1499g and gestational age 28+0 weeks to 31 + 6 weeks are included. Infants feeding with new HMF are in the experimental group. Infants feeding with other HMF are in the control group, a historically control group. Physical growth, nutritional indexes, incidence of feeding intolerance, and time to achieve full enteral feeding are compared between the two groups.

primary_outcome.description: Weight is tested daily using the same electronic weighing scale in the different study units. Growth velocity of weight is described in g/day.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Head circumference is measured weekly using a nonelastic measuring tape placed over the largest circumference of the skull weekly. Growth velocity is described in cm/week.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start day of feeding to discharge，an average of 50 days
secondary_outcome.description: Feeding intolerance is defined as feeds being withheld for 24 hours or more due to concerns related to feeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to achieve full enteral feeding
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the hospitalization，an average of 20 days
secondary_outcome.description: Infants tolerating 120mL/ kg/day of enteral feeding for >24 hours are defined as full enteral feeding.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first day of full-strength fortification feeding, the 21th days of full-strength fortification feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Blood hemoglobin is tested twice during the procedure. The change is the difference between baseline and after the intervention, described as g/dL.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first day of full-strength fortification feeding, the 21th days of full-strength fortification feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Serum albumin is tested twice during the procedure. The change is the difference between baseline and after the intervention, described as g/L.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first day of full-strength fortification feeding, the 21th days of full-strength fortification feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Serum proalbumin is tested twice during the procedure. The change is the difference between baseline and after the intervention, described as mg/L.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first day of full-strength fortification feeding, the 21th days of full-strength fortification feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Serum potassium is tested twice during the procedure. The change is the difference between baseline and after the intervention, described as mmol/L.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first day of full-strength fortification feeding, the 21th days of full-strength fortification feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Serum sodium is tested twice during the procedure. The change is the difference between baseline and after the intervention, described as mmol/L.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first day of full-strength fortification feeding, the 21th days of full-strength fortification feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Serum phosphorus is tested twice during the procedure. The change is the difference between baseline and after the intervention, described as mmol/L.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first day of full-strength fortification feeding, the 21th days of full-strength fortification feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Serum calcium is tested twice during the procedure. The change is the difference between baseline and after the intervention, described as mmol/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of serum alkaline phosphatase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first day of full-strength fortification feeding, the 21th days of full-strength fortification feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Serum alkaline phosphatase is tested twice during the procedure. The change is the difference between baseline and after the intervention, described as U/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of blood urea nitrogen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first day of full-strength fortification feeding, the 21th days of full-strength fortification feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Blood urea nitrogen is tested twice during the procedure. The change is the difference between baseline and after the intervention, described as mmol/L.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first day of full-strength fortification feeding, the 21th days of full-strength fortification feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Cholesterol is tested twice during the procedure. The change is the difference between baseline and after the intervention, described as mmol/L.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The first day of full-strength fortification feeding, the 21th days of full-strength fortification feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Triglyceride is tested twice during the procedure. The change is the difference between baseline and after the intervention, described as mmol/L.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the period using HMF, an average of 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Axillary temperature is tested by nurses using clinical electronic thermometers once every four hours. Either low body temperature ( <35℃) or high body temperature ( >37.5℃) is abnormal body temperature.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the period using HMF, an average of 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Apnea is defined as premature infants with respiratory arrest of more than 20 seconds, accompanied by a slow heartbeat, purple or pale skin, and decreased muscle tone.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the period using HMF, an average of 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Either heart rate increase (>180/min) or decrease (<90/min) is defined as abnormal heart rate.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to discharge, an average of 20 days
secondary_outcome.description: NEC is diagnosed according to the Bell's grade scale.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to discharge, an average of 40 days
secondary_outcome.description: BPD is defined as oxygen requirement at 36 weeks' postconceptional age.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to discharge, an average of 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Both culture confirmed sepsis and clinical sepsis are defined as sepsis in this study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to discharge, an average of 40 days
secondary_outcome.description: ROP is diagnosed by ophthalmologists according to fundus examination.

arm_group.description: Very preterm infants tolerating 80mL/kg/day of enteral feeding for >24 hours are started to receive the new human milk fortifier. Study procedure is from the first day of full-strength fortification feeding to the 21th days of that.
This group is a historical control group using the other HMF. Infants with similar gestational age, birth weight, feeding start time and length of hospitalization are enrolled into the control group.

intervention.description: Contents of protein, protein/energy ratio, moderate hydrolysis of whey protein, medium-chain fatty acid are increased in the new HMF

overall_official.affiliation: Children's Hospital of Fudan University, Shanghai, China

facility.name: Nanjing Maternal and Child Health Hospital
Obstetrics and Gynecoloy Hospital of Fudan University
